byline.contributor: Amy Chozick reported from Philadelphia, and Alexander Burns from New York. Yamiche Alcindor and Thomas Kaplan contributed reporting from Philadelphia.
byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and ALEXANDER BURNS

abstract: Hillary Clinton, whose victories in series of East Coast primaries ensure likelihood of clinching Democratic presidential nomination, is expected to turn her sights to general election in November; focus will shift from Democratic rival Sen Bernie Sanders to fundraising and honing message to defeat either Donald Trump or Sen Ted Cruz.
lead_paragraph: Stepping up fund-raising for the general election is among the priorities even if the Democratic nomination contest has yet to be settled.

headline.main: Pulling Away From Bernie Sanders, Hillary Clinton Is Turning to the Fall
headline.print_headline: Pulling Away From Sanders, Clinton Turns Sights to the Fall

snippet: Stepping up fund-raising for the general election is among the priorities even if the Democratic nomination contest has yet to be settled.
